summary: This bill, the 'Help Federal Employees During Shutdowns Act,' amends the Social Security Act to provide unemployment compensation benefits to federal employees who are performing emergency work during a government shutdown. States must allow eligible employees to apply for and receive compensation during lapses in appropriations for fiscal years 2026 and 2027. The bill outlines repayment procedures if employees later receive back pay, and the Secretary of the Treasury will reimburse states for the unemployment compensation provided.
